intro: Venegasia deltoidea, commonly known as the delta leaf venegasia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, deltoid-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Venegasia deltoidea typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
